product.name: T-Shirt while
product.detail: When you start designing the first mockup of your website, a landing page, or an ad copy, you might need to add some placeholder text to get an overall look and feel of your design. Right?  Placeholder text helps outline the visual elements of your design. The requirements change per your design – at times you may just need a line of text, and in some cases, you will need loads of paragraphs. But, where do you get these so-called ‘placeholder text’.

post.title: MY SPRING STYLE INSPO
post.content:
I think it’s safe to say spring has sprung! Flowers are starting to bloom, the weather is warmer, and everything is starting to come back to life (including me)! Even though life isn’t back to normal yet, it’s amazing what a difference a little bit of sunshine can make. It’s gotten me excited for some new spring looks and I’m craving all things comfortable and casual this season. (Love that loungewear is taking over streetstyle!) Here are a few of my favorite looks around Pinterest right now.
Jewelry completely transforms even the coziest looking loungewear. Just add a few layered pieces to take a ‘woke up like this’ look to an effortlessly but intentionally undone ensemble that feels put together.Such simple pieces can tie in a casual black tee like this link chain, and malachite necklace. I love this coin pendant to layer and some rings like this ridge ring, this infinity ring, and this cute bond ring.

post.title: HOW TO STYLE: CASUAL SUITS
post.content:
Comfort meets sophisticated with the new suit and I’m all for it. You can’t deny that comfort is cool and with casual suits hitting the runway from all the best designers – from The Row to Oscar de la Renta – all styled with a fresh new spin. We’re seeming them styled with sporty sneakers and eye-catching jewelry to completely transform them from an office-only look to something we could take to the streets. This season we are seeing such an amazing variety, from colorful options, lighter linen fabrics, and my personal favorite: the shorts suit making a new debut.

Here are 3 different casual suiting trends and how to style them, from sporty to sophisticated:
The colorful casual suits options right now are endless. Obsessed with this gorgeous rose suit! To bring a more casual vibe, add a cropped ribbed tee (love this one under $20 – need it in every color!) and some spring sneakers. This is a pretty paler pink option and also love this green blazer and shorts set.

post.title: HOW TO STYLE: ELEVATED ATHLEISURE
post.content:
It’s no surprise that comfort is trending right now, but sportswear isn’t just for the gym or lazy mornings. One of my favorite trends right now is elevated athleisure – going from sneakers and streetstyle to blazers and business meetings. Below are a few ways to transition your athleisure pieces for multiple occasions.
STREET STYLE LOOK: TRACK PANTS (ALSO LOVE THESE) | CROPPED HOODIE (SIMILAR HERE) | SUNGLASSES (UNDER $100) | CARGO UTILTY JACKET (UNDER $50) | TOTE | GOLD EARRINGS | SNEAKERS (UNDER $100)

OFFICE LOOK: TRACK PANTS | ONE SLEEVE TANK (ON SALE UNDER $10 – COMES IN MULTIPLE COLORS) | SUNGLASSES (UNDER $50) | CAMEL BLAZER (ON SALE UNDER $50)| LIPSTICK | BRACELET | WOVEN TOTE (ON SALE UNDER $50) | SANDALS

The starting point for making the transition from daytime to desk job? A good pair of track pants. This is another great pair and love the color scheme on this pair (under $50). Track pants pair perfectly with a white sneaker and a cropped hoodie – just add a utility jacket for an extra layer to bring in some more detail (love this one). To make your track pants work for the office, swap out the sneakers for some pretty sandals. You can also add a fitted bodysuit layered under an oversized blazer. (Would also love this look with an oversized button up for an effortless but professional feel!)
